title: Online Project-Based Education for Adult Patient External Ventricular Drainage Nursing Protocol

context.prior_knowledge: Basic neurosurgical nursing knowledge and adult patient care experience
context.additional_context: Education program combining digital device-based self-directed learning with PBL activities to improve practical skills in external ventricular drain management in hospital settings

learning_goals: Learners can explain the anatomical structure and clinical indications of external ventricular drains with at least 80% accuracy.
Learners can perform the six core steps of the standard protocol for drain management in a real-world simulation environment.
Learners can identify patient safety risks within 24 hours with over 90% accuracy by applying six protocol monitoring indicators.
Learners can write institutional protocol adaptation reports through team-based PBL (Problem-Based Learning) activities.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
